snippet: Wild chimpanzees have been listed as endangered since 1990, but a new proposal covers all chimps, including nearly 2,000 captive in the United States today.
abstract: New Fish and Wildlife Service proposal will classify all chimpanzees as endangered, including nearly 2,000 captive chimpanzees in the United States; if enacted, rule will be major success for animal welfare groups, grave disappointment for some scientists and another sign of profound changes in the way animals are used and imagined in science and popular culture.
lead_paragraph: Wild chimpanzees have been listed as endangered since 1990, but a new proposal covers all chimps, including nearly 2,000 captive in the United States today.

headline.print_headline: Goal of Broader Protection for Chimpanzees Emerges From Changing Perspectives
